body.name: Apevia ATX-ES600W Essence 600W ATX Semi-Modular Gaming Power Supply with Auto-Thermally Controlled 120mm Black Fan, 115/230V Switch, All Protections
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Wednesday, February 14. Order within 2 hrs 5 mins
features: Apevia 600W Essence ATX Semi-Modular Gaming Power Supply with black sandblasted casing
Supports Dual/Quad/Multi-core CPUs. Supports single 12V output for higher power usage.
Connectors : 1 x 20/24pin Main Power, 1 x 4+4pin 12V, 2 x PCI 6+2pin, 4 x SATA, 4 x Peripheral

IMPORTANT: The power supply will not power on simply by connecting the power cord to both the power supply and wall outlet. Ensure that all the power supply cables are properly connected to the PC for it to power on.

IMPORTANT: The 8pin CPU connector can be split apart to become a 4+4 connector by pushing one end of the 4pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 4pin power connector.

IMPORTANT: The 8pin PCI-E GPU connector can be split apart to become a 6+2 connector by pushing one end of the 6pin down and the other end of the 2pin up for graphics cards that require a 6pin power connector.

IMPORTANT: The 24pin motherboard connector can be split apart to become a 20+4 connector by pushing one end of the 20pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 20pin power connector

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.2 4.2 out of 5 stars 98 ratings 4.2 out of 5 stars

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Apevia’s Essence line of power supplies bring form and function to your system, providing high efficiency with a basic black look that fits ATX computer builds. It supports the modern 12v2.3 power standard with a single 12V rail setup. Boasting a silent 120mm black fan, it keeps everything inside the system cool. Comes with enough cables to connect all the devices you might need. The ATX-ES600W power supply is semi-modular and perfect for mid-range builds for both business and gaming use. IMPORTANT: The power supply will not power on simply by connecting the power cord to both the power supply and wall outlet. Ensure that all the power supply cables are properly connected to the PC for it to power on. IMPORTANT: The 8pin CPU connector can be split apart to become a 4+4 connector by pushing one end of the 4pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 4pin power connector. IMPORTANT: The 8pin PCI-E GPU connector can be split apart to become a 6+2 connector by pushing one end of the 6pin down and the other end of the 2pin up for graphics cards that require a 6pin power connector. IMPORTANT: The 24pin motherboard connector can be split apart to become a 20+4 connector by pushing one end of the 20pin down and the other end of the 4pin up for motherboards that require a 20pin power connector

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Value for Good PSU
reviews.reviewText: I used this in a recent build and it is working fine. The length of the connection leads is adequate for a mid-tower case. The flat leads are not as attractive (opinion) as braided covered ones but in tight spaces are easier to route. The number of connectors is adequate but somewhat limited if you have a complex build. But as the headline says, this is a great value for a good PSU.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not rated but still good
reviews.reviewText: Doesn't seem to have a certification rating but still provides all the power I need in my system

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good replacement for an ATX system board
reviews.reviewText: One day, my PC was working then it would not power on. The power supply had died. This was an affordable solution do get my PC working again.If you do not mind playing with a bunch of wires and know where they go, this is a fairly simple swap out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars I wouldn't buy tbh
reviews.reviewText: I bought this for my younger brothers Christmas present I was going to build him his first gaming PC and right out of the box it had no static protection bag just bubble wrap and foam. I got it all installed in the computer and flipped the power switch and it DID NOT WORK!! Box looked completely fine from shipping so I tried contacting support and they said there was no was they could replace it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
reviews.reviewText: THE SATA PLUGS SPACE ARE WAY TO SHORTIN LENGH AND I HAVE A NINI TOWER DELL 435M YOU CAN ONLY USE 2 OUT OF 3 HAD TO MOVE 1 PLUG SO IT CAN WORK

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Working well at about a month in, but It's the loudest component in my system by far. Steer clear if you need a quiet computer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent protection for the price
reviews.reviewText: Used this for my garage computer left over parts build (Ryzen 2600x/RTX1660). Plenty of power for this build, but pay attention to the lack of pcie connectors on the power supply. Overall, if it meets your power needs, the price is right, it's quiet, and works as it should.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Direct fit for ATX Desktop Case
reviews.reviewText: Direct fit for ATX desktop case. All the necessary wires come with it. Didn't need anything else... accommodates my SSD, 2 SATA HD's, and DVD player/burner. Very happy here and feel it well worth the price.
